title: About Me
text:
What I Do
✔ Lead Innovation – Driving analytics-driven product development & business solutions.
✔ Build AI Solutions – Developing automation, predictive models, and data-driven decision tools.
✔ Strategic Thinking – Bridging technology, analytics, and executive decision-making.

title: About Me
text:
My Journey
I am a first generation Peruvian immigrant who is passionate for improving the lives of people and bringing communities together. In the beginning of my career, I started working in the private wealth industry to help others achieve their investing goals by managing their investment data and presenting insights that would help them make informed decisions for their portfolios and finances. This interest in storytelling through data with purpose led me to pursue a Master’s degree in Data and Analytics from Northeastern. This educational experience broadened my horizons in how storytelling with data and the use of analytics can drive meaningful impact and organizational growth.
With this new perspective, I moved onto the healthcare industry in order to continue my pursuit of applying data, analytics and storytelling to drive and improve the lives of people. I started working at Premier where I am focused in formulating, designing and developing scalable solutions that aim to drive meaningful change and positive impact to business and communities that are most affected. I have led and contributed on multiple solutions  (i.e. application, dashboards, process improvements) through efforts in product design, product development, proof of concept building, evidence of business value generation and translating prototypes into production-ready solutions.
🔗 View My Projects | 🔗 Read about my experience

title: Cancer Mortality Analysis
text:
Selected for analysis due to personal family ties to cancer, part of a school project
Dataset: ~3,000 rows, 34 variables
Data Period: Roughly from 2015

title: Cancer Mortality Analysis
text:
Selected for analysis due to personal family ties to cancer, part of a school project
Dataset: ~3,000 rows, 34 variables
Data Period: Roughly from 2015

title: Cancer Mortality Analysis
section: The problem or challenge or key questions to answer
text:
The problem or challenge or key questions to answer
o   What are the causes for cancer mortality?
o   Identify what are the risk factors for cancer mortality based on county level data from US

title: Cancer Mortality Analysis
text:
Objectives

Descriptive Analytics – Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to understand the dataset.
Advanced Analytics – Use predictive modeling to identify factors associated with cancer mortality.

title: Cancer Mortality Analysis
text:
Solution Approach

Tools & Techniques

Languages: Python
Modeling Approach: Regression & Machine Learning



Analytical Workflow

Step 1: Explore & clean the data
Step 2: Prepare data for machine learning models
Step 3: Apply regression analysis & ML techniques
Step 4: Evaluate & interpret results
Step 5: Summarize findings & quantify impact

title: Cancer Mortality Analysis
text:
Analysis / Results

Before vs. After Comparison: Impact of different models on prediction accuracy.
Quantified Risk Factors: Which factors have the strongest correlation with mortality rates?
Full details in the repo: Github - Cancer Analysis

title: Cancer Mortality Analysis
text:
Learnings and challenges

Cross-validation is crucial for model reliability and is part of the next iteration
Hyperparameter tuning** improved accuracy but was time-intensive.
Stacking models** significantly increased compute time.
XGBoost outperformed other models** in predictive accuracy.
Data quality & preprocessing** played a major role in improving results.

title: Cancer Mortality Analysis
text:
Learn more

title: Bank personal loan analysis
text:
Help banks identify customers who are most likely to accept a loan approval based on past campaign results.
Started as part of school project

title: Bank personal loan analysis
text:
Help banks identify customers who are most likely to accept a loan approval based on past campaign results.
Started as part of school project

title: Bank personal loan analysis
section: The problem or challenge or key questions to answer
text:
The problem or challenge or key questions to answer
o   Help bank decide whether they should approve or reject loans based on the customer data provided by profiling the customers that are most likely to accept a loan approval based on last campaign’s result

title: Bank personal loan analysis
text:
Objectives

Data Exploration – Apply EDA techniques to uncover patterns in customer behavior.
Descriptive Analytics – Analyze relationships between variables and loan approvals.
Advanced Analytics – Build predictive models to profile ideal loan applicants.

title: Bank personal loan analysis
text:
Solution Approach

Tools & Techniques

Languages: Python
Modeling Approach: Logistic Regression, XGBoost



Analytical Workflow

Step 1: Explore & clean the data
Step 2: Prepare data for analytics & machine learning models
Step 3: Conduct A/B testing for experimentation
Step 4: Apply logistic regression & XGBoost
Step 5: Compare model performances using visualizations
Step 6: Interpret results & quantify impact

title: Bank personal loan analysis
text:
Analysis / Results

Identified key factors influencing loan acceptance rates.
Before vs. After Comparison: Improved model predictions through feature engineering.
Full details in the repo: Github - Bank Loan Analysis

title: Bank personal loan analysis
text:
Learnings and challenges

XGBoost outperformed traditional models in predictive accuracy.
Logistic regression worked well for binary classification problems.
Data visualization helped compare model performance effectively.
A/B Testing was a useful experimentation method.

text:

title: Nashville Housing Purchasing Application
text:
Interest in home ownership for living and real estate investing
Moved to Nashville around 2022
Started as school project and are currently evolving it.
Data source: Kaggle

title: Nashville Housing Purchasing Application
text:
Interest in home ownership for living and real estate investing
Moved to Nashville around 2022
Started as school project and are currently evolving it.
Data source: Kaggle

title: Nashville Housing Purchasing Application
section: The problem or challenge or key questions to answer
text:
The problem or challenge or key questions to answer
o   Find best value deals for a real estate company

title: Nashville Housing Purchasing Application
text:
Objectives

Provide data-driven analysis of the real estate market in Nashville (and beyond) to help prospective home buyers identify the best deal for them.

title: Nashville Housing Purchasing Application
text:
Solution Approach

Tools & Techniques

Languages: R
Modeling Approach: Random Forest
App Development

Front-end/back-end: R Shiny (UI/Server) and reactivity
Visualizations: ggplot package in R
Report generation: R Markdown

Design

Figma




User Experience Flow

Step 1: Read home page description
Step 2: Check out the descriptive information for visualizations about housing in Nashville
Step 3: Go to the deal prediction tab to identify which housing profile would be considered a good deal based on your inputs being applied to a ML model.

Step 3.1: Your inputs will update the model dynamically in the back end
Step 3.2: The model is going to product a prediction based on your inputs and the source data

Step 4: Go to report generation which will dynamically produce a HTML/PDF report that includes all the visualizations from the application + the deal prediction insights.

title: Nashville Housing Purchasing Application
text:
Analysis / Results

This tool is meant to provide data driven insights that will assist users in their journey to home-buying. This tool is in prototype phase and is not currently maintained.
The results for the deal prediction will be partially based on the user’s inputs.
Full details in the Github: Github - Nashville Housing Analysis

title: Nashville Housing Purchasing Application
text:
Learnings and challenges

R Shiny is a great framework for rapid app prototyping that includes statistics and ML models
The predictions in the deal prediction tool are partly limited to the quantity and quality of the data, which comes from Kaggle.

title: Nashville Housing Purchasing Application
text:
Learn more

The Challenge: Key Questions to Answer
